panels.musiclab_intro_panels_start-421d64b2-c4d:
#### Welcome to Music Lab!

Music Lab lets you mix, remix, and even perform music using code. Don’t worry if you don’t know much about code, or even music! All you need is a little time and some curiosity to start making your own creations.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-intro-20.long_instructions:
#### Change a Sound

There are tons of sounds you can choose from. Change up the beat!

Click the [name][0] of the sound to select a new one.

Then press [Run][1].

validations.musiclab_intro_change_sound_f2594aee-b7e: Nice work.  You successfully changed the sound.
validations.musiclab_intro_change_sound_38551dcf-dfa: Nice work.  You successfully changed the sound.
validations.musiclab_intro_change_sound_7a7f2fdb-045: Nice work.  You successfully changed the sound.
validations.musiclab_intro_change_sound_e63fb4ba-f0d: Nice work.  You successfully changed the sound.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-intro-20.long_instructions:
#### Play a Sound

Let's play a new sound!

Place the [play][0] block and attach it to [when run][1]. Click the name of the sound if you want to select a new sound.

Then press [Run][2].

validations.musiclab_intro_play_sound_34517aac-bcf5-: Nice work.  You successfully played a sound.
validations.musiclab_intro_play_sound_10152a9d-29b4-: Drag the [play][0] block and attach it to [when run][1].

https://studio.code.org/s/music-intro-20.long_instructions:
#### Play Together

This code currently plays a bass sound after a drum sound.

But you can also play them together at the same time.

Connect [play together][0] to [when run][1].

Then, move the two [play][2] blocks _into_ the [play together][3] block.

validations.musiclab_intro_play_together_5c2b8269-32: Nice work.  You successfully played two sounds together.
validations.musiclab_intro_play_together_92348942-20: It's good that you played one sound, but you need to play two sounds together.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-intro-20.long_instructions:
#### Repeat

Save effort and use code to repeat a sound.

Use the [repeat][0] block to play the same sound [three][1] times.

validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_eaf348ed-21a0-499e: Nice work.  You successfully played three sounds.
validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_28936cc0-3bfc-4c00: It's good that you've played a sound twice.  Please play it three times.
validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_41276380-4fc4-48cb: You've played a sound once.  Please play it three times by using the [repeat][0] block.
validations.musiclab_intro_repeat_b2a9ed31-f16f-45ac: Please play a sound three times.  Attach a [repeat][0] block to [when run][1]. Then put a [play][2] block inside of it.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_function-b2da9c67-: A cool feature in Music Lab is that you can take a set of blocks and put them into your own block.  In coding, this is called making a _function_.
panels.musiclab_intro_panels_function-e62e1783-: You can "call" your new function by using the block with the matching name, like this.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-intro-20.long_instructions:
#### Functions

You can organize your music using functions.

Click [Functions][0], then drag [bass][1] to [when run][2], to play the content of the bass function.

validations.musiclab_intro_function_b6e6f37e-268f-42: Nice work.  You successfully used the function to play a sound.
validations.musiclab_intro_function_46d4cb8f-7dcf-4b: Please play a sound by using the function.

https://studio.code.org/s/music-intro-20.long_instructions:
#### Play Live

Did you know you can do a live performance?

Attach a [play][0] block to the [triggered][1] block.

Press [Run][2] and press [1][3] to trigger the sound.

validations.musiclab_intro_trigger_5a0ba9ef-12ef-42e: Nice work.  You successfully played a sound by using the trigger.
validations.musiclab_intro_trigger_063936aa-e4fc-465: Please play a sound using the trigger.

panels.musiclab_intro_panels_end-70b08fdd-abbf-:
#### You're good to go!

You've learned the basics, and now you're ready to make your own mix! Be sure to explore the sound library - there is a lot to explore and use to make an amazing track.

You'll see even more new things in the toolbox, including:

-   A beat-making block

-   Sound effects like reverb and filter

-   A synthesizer block

-   A block for randomizing what gets played

 ...and more! Have fun!
